intro: Allantodia laxifrons, commonly known as the slender-flowered allantodia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. Native to the Mediterranean region, it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun. The plant is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats, where it forms low-growing mats. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine displays.
